age.Description: Age (in years, rounded down) at session 1

group.Description: The animals (n=24) are divided into two groups: i/ a control group which are simply housed in our animal house and visited daily with neutral interactions (n=12). ii/ a group of animals which are subjected to stressful experiences of various kinds (transport by truck, wet straw, dog barking, etc.). This group of stressed animals can be segregated into two groups of low responders (n=6) and high responders (n=6) according to their endocrine response to the stress procedure using a k-means clustering test. Based on its endocrine response and Kmean clustering results, sub-08 has been defined as an outlier.

Levels.1a: Complete protocol session : resting state fMRI, 3 Shell dwi, T1 3D (tfl3d1_ns)
Levels.1b: Incomplete protocol session : resting state fMRI only
Levels.1c: Incomplete protocol session : 3 Shell dwi only
Levels.1d: Incomplete protocol session : 3 Shell dwi and T1 3D (tfl3d1_ns) only
Levels.1e: Incomplete protocol session :  resting state fMRI and 3 Shell dwi only

Levels.1a: Complete protocol session : resting state fMRI, 3 Shell dwi, T1 3D (tfl3d1_ns)
Levels.1b: Incomplete protocol session : resting state fMRI only
Levels.1c: Incomplete protocol session : 3 Shell dwi only
Levels.1d: Incomplete protocol session : 3 Shell dwi and T1 3D (tfl3d1_ns) only
Levels.1e: Incomplete protocol session :  resting state fMRI and 3 Shell dwi only

Cortisolemia_ses-1.Description: Blood concentration of cortisol at the session 1 (pg.ml-1).

Cortisolemia_ses-2.Description: Blood concentration of cortisol at the session 2 (pg.ml-1). Used in the kmeans procedure for stress group clustering.

Cortisolemia_variation.Description: Variation of lood concentration of cortisol between session 1 and session 2 (pg.ml-1). Used in the kmeans procedure for stress group clustering.

Levels.Key: Value (This is for categorical variables: a dictionary of possible values (keys) and their descriptions (values))

size.Units: Measurement units. [<prefix symbol>]<unit symbol> format following the SI standard is RECOMMENDED
